reviews.review_msg: He is clearly passionate about what he teaches. His marking is very fair, and he is extremely helpful and is actually very willing to help. Readings were interesting, as were his lectures. Fantastic Prof.

Not surprised to see this prof rated so well. He was among the best profs I've had in English or any other course. Exteremely engaging and often hilarious style of lecturing. Only problem I had with the class is I found it was marked somewhat hard.. but that's more of a reflection of my TA than anything, I think.
Coley gives exciting and intriguing lectures. Really has a passion for what he does and makes witty jokes. Highly recommend you take a course with him!

Easily the best prof I have had at SFU. He is engaging and actually makes you want to attend lectures... which is not an easy thing to do for a 100 level English course. He gets you thinking and easily gets his point across in every lecture. Take his class if you get the chance!
A very interesting prof!
Quite possibly the coolest English prof. Animated, passionate, and funny. If Coley is teaching, I definitely recommend taking that course.

Best English prof ever, I went into this class just trying to get my an English credit and came out wanting to take medieval lit with him just because he is so hilarious and such a passionate prof. Made me really start to enjoy English.

Coley is the best, probably the most passionate and approachable profs I've ever had. Hilarious and intelligent, he really knows what he's talking about and presents things in a way that keeps everyone's interest. He's truly invested in his teaching and makes lectures a pleasure to attend.

Sexy, smart, and incredibly passionate, David Coley is pretty much the father I wished I'd always had. What do I plan on doing this Olympic Break? Sitting in my room playing my guitar and singing sweet serenades about my hero, David Coley. If I were to die and be reincarnated into anything I wanted, it would be David Coley's pet fish.
He is absolutely amazing. Very respectable, polite and knows the material he teaches well. LOVED him. One of the best no doubt, take a class with him you won't regret it!

David was my favourite professor this semester, he was not my TA unfortunately as I really enjoyed discussing the texts with him. My only regret was that it was a 100 level class as I felt the material was so amazing we would have had plenty of material to delve in deeper with. He is very encouraging and I would 100% take another of his classes.
SO BORING. His class was a snorefest. I tried to listen to him lecture and although he has some insightful things to say, his voice just puts me to sleep. I'm sorry.
lovely, warm professor. easy class if you read all the books you can get an A. easily. if you do not read you won't get more than a c
I didn't like her style at all. She has really offbeat ideas about how to teach. She picks weird literature and makes her students to ridiculous activities and assignments
mediocre teacher.  not enough clarity on assignments. very little class discussion. approachable and flexible. too inexperienced. learning contract a waste of a class.
Nadine is a great prof.
Needs to speak louder or get a better microphone. Can't hear her unless I'm at front row. Didn't record her lectures online.. and powerpoint during class is not helpful (entire slide of quotes.)

I really enjoyed her class, it was one of my favourite classes ever actually, but that was for her incorporation of SciFi.  Who doesn't want to watch Blade Runner for class?  Major girl crush too.  Everything a nerd girl could want to be when she grows up!

Good lecturer, but poorly designed course. There were too many readings that seemed to be chosen to be the most confusing ones possible, but were almost unnecessary as Werth explained the major points we need to know in class. Show up to lecture as she doesn't post her lecture slides.

Great lecturer, is always prepared. I don't think she's ever said "uhh" or lost place in what she's saying. She keeps the class interesting and is very passionate about what she teaches. Also really nice and helpful and questions are encouraged. *TA marked me*.
Awesome proof, explains concepts very well!
This course wasn't easy. The texts can be complicated. However if you go to your TA they can be very helpful!
Her lectures are not helpful at all, she goes over the plot at the lectures and general ideas which is already obvious. will never take her class again. :(

The first thing this professor said on day one was, "I'm not here to entertain you." She definitely lives up to that. Lectures are not only extremely uninteresting but her comments and interpretation of the texts are quite obvious. It's not surprising nobody will engage her trivial questions. She is very frustrating.

He is only boring if you are over stimulated. He is so funny. His comments about minorities always made me laugh. He knows about everything in literature, so only people who are no bright would ever challenge him. I highly recommend him.
Found his lectures unorganized and repetitive. The material was somewhat interesting but assignments were hard to understand.

Very tough grader, choses readings and subject material to his likings, readings very very difficult and confusing. Gives confusing feedback on what he wants. Gives tons of material every class. If you need a high gpa to enter into your program this is not the intructor for you, lots of homework, boring class time, wastes alot of class time.

I think he failed to realize that the majortiy of the class was there to fulfill WQB requirements. His thinking was advanced, his expecations extremely high, and his lectures unclear and often taken off on weird tangents. Keep up with ALL the required readings and make sure you understand what he is looking for on assignments.

Dr. Acherman's lectures were honestly my favourite this semester. And that's coming from a science major! His lectures were thought provoking and mind boggling. Yeah, the powerpoints were threadbare, but that motivates you to go to class and listen to what he has to say about the readings, which were always so interesting. Definitely recommended!
Tough, nice guy though

Marc was an amazing prof, engaging and always positive. He made effort to make any dry content more interesting with videos. He cared a lot about the well being of the class. Be prepared to read a lot, but that's expected for an English class/W credit. Definitely take a class with Marc if you can!

English 105 W was a tougher course than I had anticipated. He tried to make the lectures interesting, but he isn't as funny as he thinks. His lecture slides do not have enough detail, and he speaks too fast to notes and says that we can always go back to the slides, the slides are very limited on the information that they give.

Marc was a good prof, his ideas are very abstract and complex, you have to listen carefully. he was quite funny, but lectures can be sort of dry sometimes. only test was the final exam and one pop quiz, just a lot of reading to do. his class helped me a lot with analysis and writing skills

Acherman makes deep and abstract concepts interesting, presenting great insight towards the topics . If you are learn by listening, lucky you. He delivers most of the lecture through speech and places less information on his slides, so watch out,  visual learners! Also, I found his talks on essay writing super clear and very helpful.

Marc's lectures are hard to take notes for as there is too little on his powerpoint slides. He only appeal to those who are audio learners and neglects those who are visual learners. The reading assignments are long and confusing at times. He may be a good prof but he does not appeal to me
I think this (might be) his first class as a prof... And it is AMAZING!

Didicher is a second-wave feminist and she lets you know it on day one. Every interpretation she makes is through this lens, which is tiresome. All symbolism is either phallic or yonic, and everything is the womb. The lectures are ok, you don't need to pay attention, and you can just write that everything is sexism or racism and get good marks.

Although I heard great things about him before taking the course I can't say I was satisfied. He made jokes here and there but generally lectures were boring. The material was brutally hard and focused around American politics. He might be funny, but the class was terrible and pointless.
Great instructor and a role model for powerful women everywhere. Really helped in putting a feminist perspective into the literature. Just great.

She talks a lot during lectures but powerpoint is minimal so must listen to take notes. Sometimes will forget what she wants to say. Expects a lot for the essays, must have a "so what" statement. Must participate lots if u have her as TA. This is avg course but would help if had a better prof.
Talks to the same 3 ppl every lecture
This was a great introduction to the atheism/theism debate as it appears in literature.  The profs interest in the subject was high, and his lectures were engaging.  The exam was BRUTAL!

Everything but the final was straight forward. Steven said, many times, jokingly (or at least I thought), that we should have read the novels (5 of them) three times each. I honestly thought he was joking until I saw the final, where he required us to recall exact pages of quotes and a write about them, where you got 0 if you got the wrong page #.

Do not take him unless you want to waste your time and money. He jumps all over the place with his notes and makes the most absurd connections with the text. even some english majors in my tutorials thought he was a joke. I do not wish to take any more english courses after him. He should consider teaching IT..

I didnt read any of the books unless they were on sparknotes, did the weekly discussions the night before, started paper#1 night before, finished paper#2 on due date, studied for the exam night before and received a B over all. This class is definitely a GPA booster if you actually try! I hate English but he made it tolerable! Take him if you can!

Such a great prof. Always willing to help if you need it and gets really into the material. Made me want to take more English classes. Somewhat hard marker, but it makes you power forward (in a good way). Would definitely take again.
HE IS REALLY PASSIONATE. HIS LECTURES ARE GOOD. HOWEVER, HE IS NOT GENEROUS WITH HIS MARKS. HE EVEN GIVES HIMSELF GRADE 'B' ON SAMPLE ESSAYS HE WRITE.
Awesome class. Awesome prof.

Amazing prof! I had little interest in english (just taking it because I needed to) but he made it so interesting! He was extremely passionate about the topics he was presenting. Essays were graded fairly and his comments were very insightful. Final was different, but explained well beforehand and was very fair. Would definitely recommend!
classwasteoftime c/hwkbasedon our opinion/classarehisopinions we can't use his
No Comments
Good prof overall. Make sure you keep up with your readings for this class because it really helps when he goes over it in lecture and tutorial.

He's an alright prof, content is really dry and super easy to zone out. Some of the stuff he talks about is interesting but nothing special. Also, TAs generally mark hard. I wouldn't call this an easy class for those who aren't good in English.
I need to get out of here

fantastic and very supportive prof. he works hard for his students and challenges them to think outside their comfort zone, but he's patient. he's very engaged in his topic, but he supports students having their own interests and/or having their own thoughts, interests, and opinions. Also such a brainiac. you're lucky if you get to take his class.
Derksen is a sociologist manque.  The only person dumber than him is the moron who gave him a lit PhD.  The most missable class of my career!
Jeff Derksen provided some very interesting works for us to study. He touched upon contemporary topics and made his class engaging. He seems well versed and intellectual.

His lectures are boring but some of the stuff he says sometimes are quite interesting.  If you go to lecture, he will bore you with his monotone and he talks straight from the textbook and his notes.  He looks like those pale pasty guys in the Matrix that always wear a long black suit.  Contents of the course is OK, but he just makes it boring.
OK prof but some of the books he chose (salt figh girl) were retarted
Very good English lecturer compared to OTHER English profs. Very clear and shows interest in Globalization. Only TA marking was hard.

thumbs up.  shows definite interest in the material and the topics covered.  lectures are skippable for the most part, but some of the stuff he makes you think about is great.  and having class-author interaction was great.  even though they're his close friends.

interesting, you learn a lot about globalization's other perspectives. After a while you do get confused with how many times he says "globalization is a process" and "intensification between people, places, and things". Authors of coursebooks his friends- we had the opportunity to talk with them

Great prof - brings up a lot of interesting ideas and really makes you think! Derksen's brilliant...have you read his poetry? All in all, 105's a great class with him....but be prepared to hear "Globalization is the ocnnection between people, places and things....it's also a process." LOL.

Good prof with great ideas, but really should refrain from reading off a piece of paper in lecture. The Globalization topic is interesting, but it's too repetitive. Everything is a process. Should explain better. TA essay marking has some unfairness. TA doesn't like it, you get a bad mark.

DANG! this guy man. holy cow. everything is a freakin PROCESS in his mind! he's so crazy. although i must admit...he is nice and helpful, but dude lay off with the processes honestly! no need to keep repeating what you've said in previous lectures.

Globalization globalization globaaalllliiiiiization. Such a **** course.Lets feel bad for all the poor people in the world and feel guilty and stop shopping at GAP and drive around in cars run by olive oil and hemp products. Booooo-urns! Poetry sucks.

One of the best profs at SFU. Extremely passionate about his course and makes you feel the same. Incredibly witty and engaging. Plus he plays rock music.(in a band). TA's were very good too. A very engaging course.

one of the best profs at sfu! He knows how to engage students and get them interested in the topics discussed in class. The 5 books he chose were interesting but the last two were amazing! His lectures are EPIC! he brings in ideas from other areas of english and society that makes it so interesting! His essay topics are simple and easy to write.
Funny Prof and not bad. But no need to attend every single lecture, as long as you read the books and go to Tutorials.

Still flabbergasted by ppl's conception that he is attractive... quite the arrogant prick, but this is what ENGL is - I am an ENGL major, let's admit it guys :P He is clear, focused, structured, entertaining, but does not care much for his students. Likes the sound of his own voice... A LOT.

Ppl often rave about Budra's wit and homour. He's smart and in control of the info he presents. Entertaining at times. Still, also a bit arrogant and not as receptive of varying opinions as he could be. Good if u want HUM credit, not so much if you want debate. His TAs handle a lot of the work. I think he's great, but I'm no fan.

If you disliked high school English then THIS is the course for you. Take ENGL 105 with Budra. You will not regret this decision. He discusses interesting themes which keep you awake in lecture. The 5 novels were all very good reads as well. Well worth my money.
He's hilarious, but his lectures remain productive. Great course and prof.

The professor is entertaining and makes for a great first year English class. Because of the nature of the course, we learned a lot of pop culture, and not enough of literary topics, which made writing the essays a little harder than they should have been. Professor Budra is always there to help and is very insightful with questions asked.
Great prof, made class fun! Marking was just at the right level and exams were completely fair.

WE LOVE BUDRA and budra loves us, he does NOT have an ego he is just having fun budra is so down to earth to the point where he will joke with and even invite you to dinner parties in his tutorial.  well DRESSED, his favorite shirt matched the walls of the lecture.  DEFINITELY TAKE HIS CLASSES, budra is a beautiful man inside and out!

Great professor. Lectures are extremely interesting and he knows how to add a hint of humour into everything he teaches. His lectures are always worthwhile to attend because he keeps the attention level high with his humour and sarcasm. Overall, best teacher I've had at SFU so far. Highly recommended!
BEST PROF EVER! I would take the same class over and over again if I could! he is funny and is a great lecturer. Definitely take him for english!
he bashes popular literature constantly but his sarcasm is funny. His T.A.'s are incredibly biased and papers are marked subjectively.

Best professor I've had so far, in fact, best teacher i've ever had. His lectures are extremely interesting. First time i ever wanted to attend an English class. TA wasnt' that good so essays were marked quite hard. Final exam was not the easiest exams you'd get, a lot of writing. Definitely cool prof and i would take all of his courses if i could.

great prof. i hated english classes before but i really enjoyed his class! i acutally looked forward to lecture and he's funny. high interest in the class and great attitude to studends and really wanted us to do well. final exam super easy!

Fantastic! One of my absolute faves! Very smart, funny, makes it very interesting. If you can take anything with him you absolutely must! He will make you work for A's though.
 Not at all pretentious and likes to call out pretentious authors (rare for an English prof!)
very clear, well prepared and interesting prof..!  take a class with him..!
No Comments
his lectures are intersting but he marks hard.

Probably two 50 minutes sessions for lecture is not best suited to his teaching style: it never seemed long enough. He was flexible about the syllabus schedule to accommodate discussion that pushed the lecture content forward. Good class, really great Prof.

So boring that I realized I could be doing something better with my life than attending his lecture... like counting all the teeth in my mouth with my tongue, or picking up my brain that has oozed onto the floor due to extreme and painful boredom. If you attend class, bring a magazine.
He's very helpful towards his students. He provides good notes and hand-outs and he's very patient in helping you craft your essays. It's hard to go wrong picking Jordan Scott.

Although knowledgable, Dr. Linley is an extremely unengaging lecturer. Her lecture slides were disorganized, confusing, and impossible to study from. The tutorials were much more valuable than the lecture. Furthermore, the amount of readings required were too much for a 100-level course.  I do not recommend taking Engl 105 with Dr. Linley.

Dr Linley's lectures were unengaging, and her lecture slides confusing and hard to follow. She was extremely disorganized - one of the required texts she had assigned were incompatible with macbooks. The amount of readings required was too much for a 100 level course.
